page.title: 11ESTATE AGENT PROPERTY SURVEY
page.content: {ESTATE AGENT PRICE DETAILS JULY 1985 { {Property MARPLE M/BRIDGE MELLOR { {Flat }Â£20,000 None None {Terrace }Â£20,000 Â£28,000 Â£36,000 {Semi-det }Â£28,000 Â£33,000 Â£45,000 {Detached }Â£52,000 Â£56,000 Â£65,000 {Farmhouse }None None Â£120,000 { We found that the prices of individual houses vary greatly, depending on what they have to offer, but you can buy anything in the area from the 17th.century farmhouse to a 20th.century flat. The prices are higher than those of similar property nearer to Manchester city centre because people who work in Manchester don't mind travelling to work, and will pay more to live in the countryside.
